title: Cedar Creek & Belle Grove National Historical Park: Places To Go
body: Places To Go         George Washington's Office Winchester - Frederick County Historical Society  Area Attractions and Visitor Centers   While in Middletown:    Visit Cedar Creek and Belle Grove National Historical Park Visitor Contact Station.   Tour Belle Grove Plantation, the manor house and its gardens and grounds.    Visit the Cedar Creek Battlefield Foundation Headquarters.   Visit Hupp's Hill Civil War Museum, located in Strasburg at 33229 Old Valley Pike.    Take a driving tour of the Cedar Creek Battlefield. Driving tour booklets are available for sale at the Cedar Creek Battlefield Visitor Center, Hupp's Hill Civil War Park, Belle Grove and Cedar Creek and Belle Grove National Historic Park Visitor Contact Station. Or utilize one of the Park's self-guided driving tours of the Cedar Creek Battle.    Attend the annual reenactment of the Battle of Cedar Creek. This event is held every October in the Park.    Tour the battlefields of the Shenandoah Valley Battlefields Heritage Area. This region of the Northern Shenandoah Valley stretches from Augusta and Highland counties in the south to Frederick County in the north and encompasses over thirteen Civil War battlefields.    Stop by Cedar Creek and Belle Grove National Historical Park Interim Visitor Contact Station for information and brochures. We are located at 7712 Main St. in Middletown, VA. (Please call to ensure the office is staffed before visiting - 540-869-3051).    While visiting Winchester:  Winchester - Frederick County Visitor Center   Museum of the Shenandoah Valley    Old Courthouse Civil War Museum    Stonewall Jackson Headquarters    Kernstown Battlefield    George Washington Office
